name: ecodms
description: ecoDMS Document Management System on Debian 13 (Trixie)

credentials.note: Default demo credentials - change after setup

quick_start:
Web UI: http://<IP>:8080
Desktop Client connects to port 17001
Default login: ecodms / ecodms

faq.question: How do I access ecoDMS?
faq.answer:
Use the web interface at http://<IP>:8080 or download the desktop client
from the ecoDMS website and connect to port 17001.

faq.question: How do I activate my license?
faq.answer:
ecoDMS runs in demo mode by default (limited features).
Purchase a license at ecodms.de and activate it in the settings.

faq.question: How do I backup my documents?
faq.answer:
Use the built-in backup function in ecoDMS settings.
The data directory is located at /srv/data.

faq.question: What are the default ports?
faq.answer:
- 8080: Web interface
- 17001: Desktop client connections
- 17002: PostgreSQL database (internal)

name: jdownloader
quick_start:
1. Create a free account at https://my.jdownloader.org
2. Configure MyJDownloader credentials:
   systemctl stop jdownloader
   cat > /opt/jdownloader/cfg/org.jdownloader.api.myjdownloader.MyJDownloaderSettings.json << 'EOF'
   {
     "email": "your-email@example.com",
     "password": "your-password",
     "devicename": "JDownloader-LXC"
   }
   EOF
   chown jdownloader:jdownloader /opt/jdownloader/cfg/org.jdownloader.api.myjdownloader.MyJDownloaderSettings.json
   systemctl start jdownloader
3. Access via https://my.jdownloader.org
4. Mount your download folder as bind mount to /downloads

faq.question: How do I set up MyJDownloader?
faq.answer:
1. Create a free account at https://my.jdownloader.org
2. Stop the service: systemctl stop jdownloader
3. Edit the config file:
   nano /opt/jdownloader/cfg/org.jdownloader.api.myjdownloader.MyJDownloaderSettings.json
4. Add your credentials (email, password, devicename)
5. Fix ownership: chown jdownloader:jdownloader /opt/jdownloader/cfg/org.jdownloader.api.myjdownloader.MyJDownloaderSettings.json
6. Start the service: systemctl start jdownloader
7. Your device will appear at my.jdownloader.org

faq.question: How do I change MyJDownloader credentials?
faq.answer:
Stop the service and remove the config:
systemctl stop jdownloader
rm /opt/jdownloader/cfg/org.jdownloader.api.myjdownloader.MyJDownloaderSettings.json
Then follow the setup steps again.

faq.question: Where are downloads stored?
faq.answer:
Default: /downloads
Mount your storage as a bind mount to /downloads in Proxmox.

name: jellyfin
quick_start:
Web UI: http://<IP>:8096
Setup wizard on first start
Mount media folders as bind mounts

faq.question: How do I add media libraries?
faq.answer:
Mount your media folders as bind mounts in Proxmox (e.g., /media/movies),
then add them as libraries in Jellyfin's web UI under Dashboard > Libraries.

faq.question: How do I enable hardware transcoding?
faq.answer:
Pass through your GPU in Proxmox container settings,
then enable hardware acceleration in Dashboard > Playback > Transcoding.

faq.question: How do I access Jellyfin remotely?
faq.answer:
Set up a reverse proxy (e.g., nginx) with SSL,
or use Jellyfin's built-in HTTPS on port 8920.

name: nginx-proxy-manager
description: Nginx Proxy Manager - Web-based reverse proxy management on Debian 13 (Trixie)
quick_start:
Web UI: http://<IP>:81
Login: admin@example.com / changeme
Change password immediately!

faq.question: How do I add a proxy host?
faq.answer:
Go to Hosts > Proxy Hosts > Add Proxy Host.
Enter domain name, forward hostname/IP, and port.

faq.question: How do I get SSL certificates?
faq.answer:
When adding a proxy host, go to the SSL tab,
select "Request a new SSL Certificate" with Let's Encrypt.

faq.question: How do I expose multiple services on one IP?
faq.answer:
Create separate proxy hosts for each subdomain (e.g., app1.example.com, app2.example.com).
All will share ports 80/443 on this container.

name: nginx
quick_start:
Web Server: http://<IP>
Config: /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
Test: nginx -t
Reload: systemctl reload nginx

faq.question: How do I add a new virtual host?
faq.answer:
Create a config file in /etc/nginx/sites-available/,
then symlink it to /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/ and reload nginx.

faq.question: How do I enable SSL with Let's Encrypt?
faq.answer:
Install certbot: apt install certbot python3-certbot-nginx
Then run: certbot --nginx

faq.question: How do I check for configuration errors?
faq.answer:
Run: nginx -t
This validates the configuration before reloading.

name: shoko
quick_start:
Web UI: http://<IP>:8111
AniDB account required
Mount anime folder as bind mount

faq.question: Do I need an AniDB account?
faq.answer:
Yes, Shoko requires an AniDB account to fetch anime metadata.
Create one at https://anidb.net/user/register

faq.question: How do I add my anime library?
faq.answer:
Mount your anime folder as a bind mount in Proxmox (e.g., /anime),
then add it as an import folder in Shoko's web UI.

faq.question: How do I integrate with Jellyfin/Plex?
faq.answer:
Install the Shoko plugin for your media server.
It will use Shoko's metadata and organization.
